00021 #ifndef ARRAY_H_
00022 #define ARRAY_H_

00035 SYLPH_BEGIN_NAMESPACE
00036 class Any;
00037 template<class T> class Array;
00038 
00039 SYLPH_PUBLIC
00040 
00055 template<class T>
00056 class Array : public virtual Object {
00057 private:
00058     size_t _length;
00059 public:
00060 
00064     class iterator : public RandomAccessIterator<T, iterator> {
00065     public:
00066         typedef RandomAccessIterator<T, iterator> super;
00067 
00068         iterator(bool begin = false, Array<T>* obj = NULL)
00069         : super(begin), _obj(obj) {
00070             _currentIndex = begin ? 0 : (_obj->length - 1);
00071         }
00072 
00073         iterator(bool begin = false, const Array<T>* obj = NULL)
00074         : super(begin), _obj(const_cast<Array<T>*> (obj)) {
00075             _currentIndex = begin ? 0 : (_obj->length - 1);
00076         }
00077 
00078         bool equals(const iterator& other) const {
00079             return _currentIndex == other._currentIndex &&
00080                     _obj == other._obj;
00081         }
00082 
00083         iterator(const iterator& other) {
00084             _currentIndex = other._currentIndex;
00085             _obj = other._obj;
00086         }
00087 
00088         typename super::reference current() const {
00089             return (*_obj)[_currentIndex];
00090         }
00091 
00092         bool hasNext() const {
00093             return _currentIndex < (_obj->length - 1);
00094         }
00095 
00096         void next() const {
00097             _currentIndex++;
00098         }
00099 
00100         bool hasPrevious() const {
00101             return _currentIndex >= 0;
00102         }
00103 
00104         void previous() const {
00105             _currentIndex--;
00106         }
00107 
00108         idx_t currentIndex() const {
00109             return _currentIndex;
00110         }
00111 
00112         size_t length() const {
00113             return _obj->length;
00114         }
00115     private:
00116         mutable idx_t _currentIndex;
00117         Array<T>* _obj;
00118     };
00119     S_ITERABLE(T)
00120 public:
00127     typedef bool(*FilterFunction)(const T&, Any&);
00133     const size_t & length;
00134 
00143     inline static Array<T> fromPointer(std::size_t length, T * orig) {
00144         Array<T> ar(length);
00145         for (int x = 0; x < length; x++)ar[x] = orig[x];
00146         return ar;
00147     }
00148 public:
00149 
00156     explicit Array(std::size_t len = 0) : _length(len), length(_length),
00157             data(new Data(len)) {
00158     }
00159 
00170     Array(const std::initializer_list<T> & il) : _length(il.size()), 
00171             length(_length), data(new Data(_length)) {
00172         for (idx_t i = 0; i < il.size(); i++) {
00173             data->_carray[i] = il.begin()[i];
00174         }
00175     }
00176 
00188     template<size_t N>
00189     Array(const T(&array)[N]) : _length(N), length(_length), data(new Data(N)) {
00190         for (idx_t i = 0; i < _length; i++) {
00191             data->_carray[i] = array[i];
00192         }
00193     }
00194 
00203     Array(const Array<T> & other) : _length(other._length), length(_length),
00204         data(other.data){
00205         data->refcount++;
00206     }
00207 
00219     Array(const basic_range<T> & ran) : _length(ran.last() - ran.first()),
00220     length(_length), data(new Data(length)) {
00221         idx_t idx = 0;
00222         for (T x = ran.first(); x < ran.last(); x++) {
00223             *this[idx] = x;
00224             idx++;
00225         }
00226     }
00227 
00238     explicit Array(const T& t) : _length(1), length(_length),
00239             data(new Data(1)) {
00240         data->_carray[0] = t;
00241     }
00242 
00247     virtual ~Array() {
00248         data->refcount--;
00249         if (!data->refcount) {
00250             delete data;
00251             data = NULL;
00252         }
00253     }
00254 
00263     Array<T> copy() const {
00264         Array<T> toReturn((std::size_t)length);
00265         for (idx_t i = 0; i < length; i++) {
00266             toReturn[i] = (*this)[i];
00267         }
00268         return toReturn;
00269     }
00270 
00276     T * carray() {
00277         return data->_carray;
00278     }
00279 
00286     const T *carray() const {
00287         return data->_carray;
00288     }
00289 
00298     Array<T> filter(FilterFunction func, Any& clientData) {
00299         // I'm terribly sorry but we'll need to iterate twice over the Array...
00300         size_t newlength;
00301         for (idx_t i = 0; i < length; i++) {
00302             if (func(*this[i], clientData)) newlength++;
00303         }
00304         Array<T> toReturn(newlength);
00305         idx_t curpos = 0;
00306         for (idx_t i = 0; i < length; i++) {
00307             if (func(*this[i], clientData)) {
00308                 toReturn[curpos] = *this[i];
00309                 curpos++;
00310             }
00311         }
00312         return toReturn;
00313     }
00314 
00319     void clear() {
00320         delete this->data->_carray;
00321         this->data->_carray = new T[this->data->_length];
00322     }
00323 
00332     Array<T> & operator=(const Array<T> & other) {
00333         if (this->data == other.data) return *this;
00334         this->data->refcount--;
00335         if (!this->data->refcount) delete this->data;
00336         this->data = other.data;
00337         this->_length = other.data->_length;
00338         data->refcount++;
00339         return *this;
00340     }
00341 
00350     T & operator[](std::sidx_t idx) throw (Exception) {
00351         if ((idx < (sidx_t)length) && (idx >= -(sidx_t)length)) {
00352             return idx >= 0 ? data->_carray[idx] : data->_carray[length + idx];
00353         } else {
00354             sthrow(ArrayException, "Array overflow");
00355         }
00356     }
00357 
00365     const T & operator[](std::sidx_t idx) const throw (Exception) {
00366         if ((idx < (sidx_t)length) && (idx >= -(sidx_t)length)) {
00367             return idx >= 0 ? data->_carray[idx] : data->_carray[length + idx];
00368         } else {
00369             sthrow(ArrayException, "Array overflow");
00370         }
00371     }
00372 
00381     Array<T> operator[](const range & ran) throw (Exception) {
00382         if (ran.first() < 0 || ran.last() >= length)
00383             sthrow(ArrayException, "Array overflow");
00384 
00385         Array<T> toReturn = Array<T>::fromPointer((ran.last() - ran.first())+1,
00386                 data->_carray + ran.first());
00387         return toReturn;
00388     }
00389 
00395     const Array<T> operator[](const range & ran) const throw (Exception) {
00396         if (ran.first() < 0 || ran.last() >= length)
00397             sthrow(ArrayException, "Array overflow");
00398 
00399         Array<T> toReturn = Array<T>::fromPointer((ran.last() - ran.first())+1,
00400                 data->_carray + ran.first());
00401         return toReturn;
00402     }
00403 
00404 #ifndef SYLPH_DOXYGEN
00405 protected:
00406 
00407     struct Data {
00408 
00409         explicit Data(size_t length) : _length(length), 
00410                  _carray(new T[length]()), refcount(1) {
00411 
00412         }
00413 
00414         virtual ~Data() {
00415             delete _carray;
00416         }
00417         const size_t _length;
00418         T * _carray;
00419         suint refcount;
00420     } * data;
00421 #endif
00422 };
00423 
00432 template<class T>
00433 inline bool operator==(const Array<T>& lhs, const Array<T>& rhs) {
00434     if(lhs.length == rhs.length) {
00435         for(idx_t i = 0; i < lhs.length; i++) {
00436             if(lhs[i] != rhs[i]) return false;
00437         }
00438         return true;
00439     }
00440     return false;
00441 }
00442 
00451 template<class T>
00452 inline bool operator<(const Array<T>& lhs, const Array<T>& rhs) {
00453     return std::lexicographical_compare(&lhs[0], &lhs[lhs.length-1],
00454             &rhs[0], &rhs[rhs.length-1]);
00455 }
00456 
00457 SYLPH_END_NAMESPACE
00458 
00459 #endif  /* ARRAY_H_ */
